ground_truth: Cole just closes his eyes and holds his mom tight. We are in an antique store filled floor to ceiling with furniture and knickknacks. Anna stands with a young couple, and all three lean over and peer into a glass cabinet where an antique engagement ring sits on a velvet stand. The young woman looks at her beau, and she places it in their hands. The young woman looks at Anna with great intrigue, while the young man throws an odd glance at his fiancée. The young man and the young woman gaze at Anna silently before they look down at the ring. Anna moves to the back desk where Sean comes out carrying an antique bench in his arms, places it down, and takes a much-needed seat. Anna looks over to find Sean standing at his desk where a birthday present sits on his tabletop. Sean looks at her. Malcolm looks up sharply. Cole is crying now during a long pause as they both just stare. Cole searches for the answer in Malcolm's eyes, then pushes it across the table. Malcolm gazes at it, then looks up at Cole's pained eyes. Malcolm sits stoically at his desk in his basement, leans his head back against the chair, and stares into the shadows. Malcolm's eyes scan the room and come to a stop on a box marked with the label. A tape slides into the tape player seated on Malcolm's desk, and Malcolm's eyes are locked on the spool of audio tape as it spins in the player. Malcolm's fingers move to the volume dial, turns it way up, and the static noise from the tape fills the basement. Cole holds up his plastic rifleman, and Malcolm's eyes show he understands now. Malcolm glances around the empty church before looking back up at Cole, who looks nervous. Cole and Malcolm stand silently in the center aisle at the back of the church, and Malcolm moves around the corner on his street. His mind surges with thoughts, and then he glances up. His steps slow to a complete stop. Further down the sidewalk, coming out of the front door of his house is Sean. Malcolm's face turns to stone as he watches Sean come down the front stairs and start across the street. Malcolm moves towards Sean fast, but Sean reaches his car and enters it. Sean pulls away into traffic, almost hitting another car as he does, and Malcolm watches the car disappear down the next street. Malcolm turns and looks up at his home with unchecked anger and overwhelming pain erupting in his eyes. Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent. He stumbles out. A table with a sewing machine fills the other side of the room.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Cole simply shuts his lids and grips his mother tightly. We are in a vintage shop laden floor to ceiling with furniture and trinkets. Anna stands with a youthful pair, and all three bend over and gaze into a glass cabinet where a vintage engagement band rests on a velvet display. The young woman glances at her partner, and she lays it in their palms. The young woman glances at Anna with great curiosity, while the young man casts a peculiar look at his fiancée. The young man and the young woman gaze at Anna silently before they glance down at the ring. Anna moves to the rear desk where Sean emerges carrying a vintage bench in his arms, sets it down, and takes a much-needed seat. Anna glances over to find Sean standing at his desk where a birthday gift rests on his tabletop. Sean glances at her. Malcolm looks up abruptly. Cole is weeping now during a lengthy pause as they both just gaze. Cole searches for the response in Malcolm's eyes, then pushes it across the table. Malcolm gazes at it, then glances up at Cole's pained eyes. Malcolm sits stoically at his desk in his basement, leans his head back against the chair, and stares into the shadows. Malcolm's eyes scan the room and stop on a box marked with the label. A tape slides into the tape player seated on Malcolm's desk, and Malcolm's eyes are fixed on the spool of audio tape as it spins in the player. Malcolm's fingers move to the volume dial, twists it way up, and the static noise from the tape fills the basement. Cole holds up his plastic soldier, and Malcolm's eyes show he comprehends now. Malcolm glances around the barren church before looking back up at Cole, who seems nervous. Cole and Malcolm stand silently in the center aisle at the rear of the church, and Malcolm moves around the corner on his street. His mind surges with thoughts, and then he glances up. His steps slow to a complete stop. Further down the pavement, emerging from the front door of his home is Sean. Malcolm's face turns to stone as he watches Sean descend the front steps and start across the street. Malcolm moves towards Sean quickly, but Sean reaches his vehicle and enters it. Sean pulls away into traffic, nearly hitting another vehicle as he does, and Malcolm watches the vehicle vanish down the next street. Malcolm turns and glances up at his abode with unchecked rage and overwhelming anguish erupting in his eyes. Cole hastily rises and dashes out of the tent. He stumbles out. A table with a sewing machine occupies the other side of the room.

Anna is gazed at silently by the young man and the young woman before the ring is looked down at by them. The back desk is moved to by Anna where Sean carries an antique bench out, places it down, and takes a much-needed seat. Sean is looked at by Anna, and she sees him standing at his desk where a birthday present sits on the tabletop. He looks at Anna. A sharp look is given by Malcolm. A long pause occurs as Cole cries and they both just stare. Malcolm’s eyes are searched by Cole for the answer, then it is pushed across the table by him. It is gazed at by Malcolm, then he looks up at Cole's pained eyes. Stoically, Malcolm sits at his desk in his basement, leans his head back against the chair, and stares into the shadows. The room is scanned by Malcolm's eyes and comes to a stop on a box marked with the label. A tape slides by someone into the tape player seated on Malcolm's desk, and the spool of audio tape spinning in the player is locked on by Malcolm's eyes. The volume dial is moved by Malcolm's fingers, turning it way up, and the basement is filled with the static noise from the tape. Cole holds up his plastic rifleman, and understanding now is shown in Malcolm's eyes. The empty church is glanced around by Malcolm before Cole, who looks nervous, is looked back at. In the center aisle at the back of the church, Cole and Malcolm stand silently, and the corner on his street is moved around by Malcolm. Thoughts surge in his mind, and then he glances up. His steps are slowed to a complete stop. Further down the sidewalk, Sean is seen coming out of the front door of his house. As Sean is watched by Malcolm coming down the front stairs and starting across the street, Malcolm's face turns to stone. Sean is moved towards fast by Malcolm, but his car is reached by Sean, and he enters it. Traffic is pulled away into by Sean, almost hitting another car as he does, and the car is watched by Malcolm disappearing down the next street. His home is looked up at by Malcolm with unchecked anger and overwhelming pain erupting in his eyes. Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent. He is stumbled out. The other side of the room is filled by a table with a sewing machine.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Cole embraces his mom, eyes closed, in an antique store brimming with furniture and knickknacks. Anna peers into a glass cabinet with a young couple, examining an antique engagement ring. The young woman intriguedly gazes at Anna, while her fiancé glances oddly. They look silently at Anna, then the ring. Anna moves as Sean appears with an antique bench, places it down, and sits beside a desk with a birthday present. Sean looks at Anna. Malcolm glances up sharply. A tearful Cole stares at Malcolm, searching his eyes before pushing something across the table. Malcolm observes Cole's pained expression, then reclines in his basement chair, staring into the shadows. His eyes pause on a labeled box. A tape spins in the player, its static noise filling the room as Malcolm turns up the volume. Cole raises his plastic rifleman, and Malcolm shows understanding. Malcolm briefly takes in the empty church, then looks back at Cole, who seems nervous. In the church aisle, Malcolm moves around, lost in thought, and eventually stops. Down the sidewalk, Sean exits Malcolm's house. Malcolm's expression hardens as Sean reaches his car and drives away into traffic. Witnessing the near accident, Malcolm's rage and pain surface as he glances at his home. Cole rushes out of the tent, stumbling. A sewing machine occupies a nearby table.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Cole hugs his mom tightly with his eyes closed. In an antique store filled with furniture and knickknacks, Anna, with a young couple, peers into a cabinet at an antique engagement ring. The young woman, with intrigue, and the man exchange glances before looking at Anna silently, then the ring. Sean appears with an antique bench, sits down, and notices a birthday present at his desk. Cole cries, searching Malcolm's eyes for answers. Malcolm, at his basement desk, stares into shadows, focusing on an audio tape. Turning up the volume, static fills the room. Understanding dawns as Malcolm observes Cole with a plastic rifleman. In an empty church, Malcolm and Cole stand together. On his street, Malcolm stops as Sean leaves his house, enters his car, and narrowly avoids hitting another car before driving away. Malcolm watches, anger and pain evident, before Cole rushes out of a tent, stumbling past a sewing machine.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: With his heart heavy, Cole simply squeezes his eyes shut and clings tightly to his mother. We find ourselves in a charming antique store, a place densely packed from floor to ceiling with an eclectic array of vintage furniture and fascinating knickknacks. Standing nearby, Anna engages in conversation with a young couple. All three individuals bend slightly forward, curiously peering into a glass display case where an exquisite antique engagement ring rests elegantly on a plush velvet stand. The young woman, filled with anticipation, exchanges meaningful glances with her beau as she carefully places the ring in their hands. Her eyes, full of intrigue, drift towards Anna, while her fiancé casts a peculiar glance at her. Both the young man and woman linger in silence, gazing at Anna momentarily before their attention returns to the captivating ring. Meanwhile, Anna shifts her focus to the back of the store, where Sean emerges, carrying an antique bench in his arms with some effort. He places it down gently and takes a much-needed break in the form of a seat. Anna's gaze travels over to Sean, who is now stationed at his desk, where a birthday gift is prominently displayed on the tabletop. Sean meets her gaze. Suddenly, Malcolm looks up sharply, his attention drawn back to the room. In a moment filled with emotion, Cole begins to cry during an extended, silent pause, searching Malcolm's eyes for an elusive answer. He then pushes something across the table toward Malcolm. As Malcolm observes this, his eyes meet Cole's, which are filled with evident pain. Sitting stoically at his desk in the dimly lit basement, Malcolm leans his head back against the chair, staring off into the shadows that fill the room. His eyes scan the surroundings until they fixate on a box marked with a distinctive label. With deliberate motion, a tape is inserted into the tape player, located prominently on Malcolm's desk, and he watches intently as the spool of audio tape begins to spin. His fingers deftly twist the volume dial, turning it up significantly, allowing the static noise from the tape to permeate the basement space. In a meaningful gesture, Cole lifts up his plastic rifleman, and Malcolm’s expression reveals a newfound understanding. Sitting in the quiet expanse of an empty church, Malcolm shifts his gaze back to Cole, who stands with a hint of nervousness. The two of them remain in the center aisle at the rear of the church, while Malcolm mentally revisits familiar streets corners. Abruptly, he halts. Down the sidewalk, emerging from the front door of his home, is Sean. Malcolm’s face hardens as he observes Sean make his way down the front stairs and begin crossing the street. With purpose, Malcolm moves quickly in Sean's direction, but not quickly enough; Sean reaches his vehicle, enters it, and seamlessly pulls into traffic, narrowly avoiding another car. Malcolm stands frozen, watching as Sean’s car vanishes around the next corner. With anger and deep-seated pain now consuming his expression, Malcolm turns his eyes toward his own home. Concurrently, Cole, in a hurry, gets up and rushes out of the tent, stumbling hastily into the open air. Nearby, the other side of the room is dominated by a table equipped with a sewing machine.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With his heart weighed down by emotion, Cole tightly shuts his eyes and clings firmly to his mother, seeking comfort and solace in her presence. We find ourselves enveloped in the quaint ambiance of a charming antique store, a place densely packed from floor to ceiling with an eclectic array of vintage furniture and an intriguing collection of fascinating knickknacks. In close proximity, Anna is engaged in a lively conversation with a young couple. All three individuals slightly bend forward, their curiosity piqued, as they peer intently into a glass display case that houses an exquisite antique engagement ring, resting elegantly on a plush velvet stand. The young woman, filled with excitement and anticipation, exchanges meaningful glances with her beau as she delicately places the ring in their hands. Her eyes, brimming with intrigue, drift towards Anna, while her fiancé casts her a peculiar glance. Both the young man and woman linger in an intense silence, their gaze momentarily fixed on Anna before their attention shifts back to the captivating ring. Meanwhile, Anna redirects her focus toward the back of the store, where Sean emerges, carrying an antique bench laboriously in his arms. With care, he places it down gently and takes a much-needed break by sitting on it. Anna's gaze travels over to Sean, who is now stationed at his desk, where a prominent birthday gift rests on the tabletop. Sean catches her gaze, and for a fleeting moment, their eyes meet. Suddenly, Malcolm raises his head sharply, his attention abruptly drawn back to the room. Overflowing with emotion, Cole begins to cry during a prolonged, silent pause, searching Malcolm's eyes in vain for an elusive answer. He then pushes something across the table toward Malcolm. As Malcolm observes this action, his eyes meet Cole's, which are filled with evident pain and longing for understanding. Sitting with a stoic demeanor at his desk in the dimly lit basement, Malcolm leans his head back against his chair, his gaze drifting into the shadows that encompass the room. His eyes methodically scan the dim surroundings until they fixate on a box marked with a distinctive label. With deliberate motion, Malcolm inserts a tape into the tape player prominently situated on his desk and watches intently as the spool of audio tape begins to spin. His fingers deftly twist the volume dial, turning it up substantially, allowing the static noise from the tape to permeate the basement space with its presence. In a meaningful gesture, Cole lifts up his plastic rifleman, and an expression of newfound understanding spreads across Malcolm’s face. Sitting in the quiet expanse of an empty church, Malcolm refocuses his gaze back to Cole, who stands with a hint of nervousness evident in his posture. The two of them remain in the center aisle at the rear of the church, while Malcolm mentally revisits familiar street corners as memories flood back. Abruptly, he halts his thoughts. Down the sidewalk, emerging from the front door of his home, is Sean. Malcolm’s face hardens as he observes Sean make his descent down the front stairs and begin crossing the street with a determined stride. With a sense of purpose, Malcolm moves quickly in Sean's direction, but not quickly enough; Sean reaches his vehicle, enters it, and seamlessly merges into the flow of traffic, narrowly avoiding contact with another car. Malcolm stands, frozen in place, watching as Sean’s car vanishes around the next corner, leaving him behind. With anger and deep-seated pain now consuming his expression, Malcolm directs his eyes toward the familiar facade of his own home. At the same time, Cole, in a flurry of urgency, gets up and rushes out of the tent, stumbling hastily into the open air. Nearby, the other side of the room is dominated by the presence of a table equipped with a sewing machine, standing silently as a testament to the room's multifaceted nature.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Cole closes his eyes tightly and instinctively wraps his arms around his mom, clinging to her with a firm embrace that conveys both comfort and need. While he holds his mom, the scene around them is bathed in a nostalgic charm as they stand amidst an antique store filled to the brim with vintage furniture and an assortment of knickknacks, each item whispering tales of the past. Nearby, Anna positions herself alongside a young couple, the three of them bending forward with careful deliberation as they peer intently into a glass cabinet. Inside the cabinet, an antique engagement ring sits prominently on a velvet stand, drawing their collective focus. The young woman turns her gaze towards her beau, a silent communion passing between them, and delicately places the ring into their waiting hands. Her eyes shift to Anna, filled with intrigue and questions unspoken, while the young man casts a perplexed glance at his fiancée, his expression a mixture of curiosity and uncertainty. The couple directs their attention back to Anna, their eyes resting on her as they process the significance of the ring in their hands, creating a moment of silent communication before they return their focus to the ring itself. With a purposeful motion, Anna makes her way to the back desk. Here, Sean emerges, carrying an antique bench in his arms, each step carefully measured until he reaches a spot to place it down. Relieved of his burden, he sinks into a welcoming seat. Anna's gaze shifts and finds Sean standing at his own desk, where a neatly wrapped birthday present occupies a prominent spot on the tabletop. Their eyes meet briefly with an unspoken understanding passing between them. Nearby, Malcolm suddenly looks up, his senses heightened. During a brief pause, Cole's emotions overwhelm him, and tears escape his eyes as he looks across the table in search of solace in Malcolm's gaze. Without a word, Cole pushes something towards Malcolm, a silent plea for understanding. Malcolm's eyes, filled with empathy, linger on it before lifting to meet Cole's anguished gaze. In another setting, Malcolm sits alone at his desk in the dimly lit basement, his body sinking deep into the chair, his head leaning back to rest as his eyes drift into the obscured corners of the room, reflecting on the shadows. Slowly, his gaze finds its way to a box distinguished by a label, prompting a flicker of recognition. His hand moves with intention as he slides a tape into the player on his desk, his eyes fixed intently on the spinning spool of the audio tape as it whirs to life. With a deliberate motion, he adjusts the volume dial, turning it up significantly until the basement is filled with the sharp hiss of static noise emanating from the tape. As the noise envelops them, Cole holds up his plastic rifleman, a simple gesture that speaks volumes, and Malcolm's eyes light up with understanding, bridging the gap between them. As Malcolm takes in the scene around him, his eyes scan the empty church, taking note of its quiet solemnity, before they return to Cole, who shifts nervously under the weight of the moment. The two of them stand poised in the center aisle at the back of the church, a shared silence enveloping them. Malcolm then moves briskly around the corner on his street, his thoughts a whirlwind as they surge through his mind. His steps falter, eventually coming to a full stop, as he looks up and spots Sean emerging from the front door of his house, further down the sidewalk. Malcolm's expression hardens, turning to stone, as he watches Sean descend the front stairs and start across the street. Urgency propels Malcolm forward, but Sean moves swiftly, reaching his car and getting inside before Malcolm can intercept. As Sean pulls away, his car veering into the flow of traffic, narrowly missing another vehicle, Malcolm stands rooted to the spot, watching as Sean's car fades from view around the next street. The intensity of the moment manifests in Malcolm's face, unchecked anger and deep-seated pain blazing in his eyes as he turns his gaze upwards towards the house that holds so much significance. Meanwhile, Cole springs up with sudden energy, bursting out of the tent with hurried, stumbling steps, his momentum carrying him into a room dominated by a table, where a sewing machine sits, ready for use.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Cole embraces his mom tightly with his eyes closed. In an antique store filled with furniture and knickknacks, Anna is with a young couple, all examining an antique engagement ring inside a glass cabinet. The young woman shows interest in the ring, while her partner appears puzzled. The couple exchange looks with Anna before focusing on the ring again. Meanwhile, Anna moves to the back desk as Sean emerges carrying an antique bench, places it down, and takes a seat. She notices a birthday present on Sean's desk as he meets her gaze, and Malcolm suddenly looks up. Cole, now crying, searches Malcolm's eyes for answers and slides something across the table. Malcolm, after a moment of contemplation, responds to Cole's silent plea. Seated in his basement, Malcolm leans back and stares into the shadows, his gaze settling on a box. He inserts a tape into a player, turning up the volume as static fills the room. Cole lifts his plastic rifleman, and Malcolm understands, glancing around the empty church before focusing back on a nervous Cole. They stand in the church aisle's center, and Malcolm later makes his way around his street corner. He stops abruptly as he sees Sean exiting his house and heading toward his car. Malcolm hurries, but Sean drives away recklessly, narrowly avoiding an accident. As Sean's car vanishes, Malcolm turns toward his home, his face hardening with anger and pain. Meanwhile, Cole rushes out of the tent, stumbling as he goes, past a table with a sewing machine.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Cole, a young boy overwhelmed by emotions, just closes his eyes and holds his mom tight. We are in an antique store, a treasure trove from another era, filled floor to ceiling with furniture and knickknacks that hold stories from the past. Anna stands with a young couple, potential buyers, and all three lean over and peer into a glass cabinet where an antique engagement ring, rumored to have adorned the hand of a 19th-century aristocrat, sits on a velvet stand. The young woman looks at her beau, and she places it in their hands, a gesture full of hope and future promises. The young woman looks at Anna with great intrigue, perhaps impressed by her knowledge of the jewelry's history, while the young man throws an odd glance at his fiancée, perhaps unsure about the investment. The young man and the young woman gaze at Anna silently before they look down at the ring, contemplating the significance of its lineage. Anna moves to the back desk where Sean comes out carrying an antique bench, crafted by artisans long ago, in his arms, places it down, and takes a much-needed seat. Anna looks over to find Sean standing at his desk where a birthday present, wrapped with care, sits on his tabletop. Sean looks at her, a silent exchange of familiarity. Malcolm looks up sharply, his attention caught. Cole is crying now during a long pause as they both just stare, the emotion of the moment overwhelming. Cole searches for the answer in Malcolm's eyes, a man known for his steadfast resolve, then pushes it across the table. Malcolm, once a detective, gazes at it, then looks up at Cole's pained eyes, understanding the gravity of the situation. Malcolm sits stoically at his desk in his basement, a space cluttered with memories and case files, leans his head back against the chair, and stares into the shadows that seem to whisper secrets. Malcolm's eyes scan the room and come to a stop on a box marked with the label, possibly filled with remnants of past investigations. A tape slides into the tape player seated on Malcolm's desk, technology from a past era, and Malcolm's eyes are locked on the spool of audio tape as it spins in the player, the sound of nostalgia. Malcolm's fingers move to the volume dial, turns it way up, and the static noise from the tape fills the basement like a ghost from the past. Cole holds up his plastic rifleman, a relic of childhood innocence, and Malcolm's eyes show he understands now, the connection made. Malcolm glances around the empty church, a place of reflection and solace, before looking back up at Cole, who looks nervous, caught in a moment of vulnerability. Cole and Malcolm stand silently in the center aisle at the back of the church, and Malcolm moves around the corner on his street, where every crack in the pavement is familiar. His mind surges with thoughts, memories flooding back, and then he glances up. His steps slow to a complete stop. Further down the sidewalk, coming out of the front door of his house, is Sean, the source of Malcolm's recent turmoil. Malcolm's face turns to stone as he watches Sean come down the front stairs and start across the street, a confrontation inevitable. Malcolm moves towards Sean fast, but Sean reaches his car and enters it. Sean pulls away into traffic, the screech of tires almost hitting another car as he does, and Malcolm watches the car disappear down the next street, a feeling of helplessness washing over him. Malcolm turns and looks up at his home with unchecked anger and overwhelming pain erupting in his eyes, emotions he struggles to contain. Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent, a place of temporary refuge. He stumbles out, emotions raw and unrefined. A table with a sewing machine, a tool of creation and repair, fills the other side of the room, a reminder of simpler, more peaceful times.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Cole just closes his eyes and holds his mom tight. We are in an antique store filled floor to ceiling with furniture and knickknacks. Anna stands with a young couple and all three lean over and peer into a glass cabinet where an antique engagement ring sits on a velvet stand. The young woman looks at her beau and she places it in their hands. The young woman looks at Anna with great intrigue while the young man throws an odd glance at his fiancée. The young man and the young woman gaze at Anna silently before they look down at the ring. Anna looks over to find Sean standing at his desk where a birthday present sits on his tabletop. Sean looks at her. Malcolm looks up sharply. Cole is crying now during a long pause as they both just stare. Cole searches for the answer in Malcolm's eyes then pushes it across the table. Malcolm gazes at it then looks up at Cole's pained eyes. Malcolm sits stoically at his desk in his basement leans his head back against the chair and stares into the shadows. Malcolm's eyes scan the room and come to a stop on a box marked with the label. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. A tape slides into the tape player seated on Malcolm's desk and Malcolm's eyes are locked on the spool of audio tape as it spins in the player. Malcolm's fingers move to the volume dial turns it way up and the static noise from the tape fills the basement. Cole holds up his plastic rifleman and Malcolm's eyes show he understands now. Malcolm glances around the empty church before looking back up at Cole who looks nervous. Cole and Malcolm stand silently in the center aisle at the back of the church and Malcolm moves around the corner on his street. His mind surges with thoughts and then he glances up. His steps slow to a complete stop. Further down the sidewalk coming out of the front door of his house is Sean. Malcolm's face turns to stone as he watches Sean come down the front stairs and start across the street. Malcolm moves towards Sean fast but Sean reaches his car and enters it. Sean pulls away into traffic almost hitting another car as he does and Malcolm watches the car disappear down the next street. Malcolm turns and looks up at his home with unchecked anger and overwhelming pain erupting in his eyes. Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent. He stumbles out. A table with a sewing machine fills the other side of the room.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. A tape slides into the tape player seated on Malcolm's desk and Malcolm's eyes are locked on the spool of audio tape as it spins in the player. Malcolm's fingers move to the volume dial turns it way up and the static noise from the tape fills the basement. Cole holds up his plastic rifleman and Malcolm's eyes show he understands now. Malcolm glances around the empty church before looking back up at Cole who looks nervous. Cole and Malcolm stand silently in the center aisle at the back of the church and Malcolm moves around the corner on his street. His mind surges with thoughts and then he glances up. His steps slow to a complete stop. Further down the sidewalk coming out of the front door of his house is Sean. Malcolm's face turns to stone as he watches Sean come down the front stairs and start across the street. Malcolm moves towards Sean fast but Sean reaches his car and enters it. Sean pulls away into traffic almost hitting another car as he does and Malcolm watches the car disappear down the next street. Malcolm turns and looks up at his home with unchecked anger and overwhelming pain erupting in his eyes. Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent. He stumbles out. A table with a sewing machine fills the other side of the room.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Cole just closes his eyes and holds his mom tight. We are in an antique store filled floor to ceiling with furniture and knickknacks. Anna stands with a young couple and all three lean over and peer into a glass cabinet where an antique engagement ring sits on a velvet stand. The young woman looks at her beau and she places it in their hands. The young woman looks at Anna with great intrigue while the young man throws an odd glance at his fiancée. The young man and the young woman gaze at Anna silently before they look down at the ring. Anna moves to the back desk where Sean comes out carrying an antique bench in his arms places it down and takes a muchneeded seat. Anna looks over to find Sean standing at his desk where a birthday present sits on his tabletop. Malcolm's face turns to stone as he watches Sean come down the front stairs and start across the street. Malcolm moves towards Sean fast but Sean reaches his car and enters it. Sean pulls away into traffic almost hitting another car as he does and Malcolm watches the car disappear down the next street. Malcolm turns and looks up at his home with unchecked anger and overwhelming pain erupting in his eyes. Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent. He stumbles out. A table with a sewing machine fills the other side of the room.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Cole just closes his eyes and holds his mom tight. We are in an antique store filled floor to ceiling with furniture and knickknacks. Anna stands with a young couple and all three lean over and peer into a glass cabinet where an antique engagement ring sits on a velvet stand. Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent. He stumbles out. A table with a sewing machine fills the other side of the room.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Lori casually opens her ears and hugs her dog loose. We are in a bakery crowded wall to ceiling with paintings and souvenirs. Bella stands with an elderly man, and all three crouch down and squint into a wooden barrel where a vintage bracelet dangles on a silk thread. The elderly woman glances at her granddaughter, and she places it on their feet. The elderly woman stares at Bella with mild confusion, while the elderly man tosses a curious look at his granddaughter. The elderly man and the elderly woman blink at Bella quietly before they gaze down at the bracelet. Bella drifts to the front shelf where Jerry strolls in carrying an old piano on his shoulder, lays it down, and takes a much-needed nap. Bella gazes over to spot Jerry lounging at his shelf where a lunchbox reclines on his counter. Jerry grins at her. Robert glances up slowly. Lori is laughing now during a short gap as they both just blink. Lori searches for the clue in Robert's cheeks, then pulls it across the bench. Robert squints at it, then glances up at Lori's relieved cheeks. Robert sits hunched at his bench in his attic, lowers his head against the shelf, and gazes into the daylight. Robert's cheeks scan the yard and rest on a crate scribbled with a label. A book slides into the notebook resting on Robert's bench, and Robert's cheeks are fixated on the pile of paper as it flips in the notebook. Robert's toes stretch to the brightness knob, turns it down low, and the silent hum from the paper envelops the attic. Lori waves up her wooden soldier, and Robert's cheeks show he realizes then. Robert scans around the vacant theater before glancing down at Lori, who looks content. Lori and Robert sit quietly on a side bench in the front of the theater, and Robert drifts past the curb on his road. His heart rushes with memories, and then he peers down. His walk speeds to a brisk run. Nearby on the road, exiting from the back gate of his cabin is Jerry. Robert's smile turns to ice as he observes Jerry descend the back steps and begin around the corner. Robert drifts towards Jerry slow, but Jerry reaches his bike and hops on it. Jerry pedals away onto the path, nearly missing a pedestrian as he does, and Robert observes the bike vanish behind the next building. Robert whirls and lowers his gaze at his cabin with measured joy and deep relief swelling in his cheeks. Lori calmly rises and strolls out of the tunnel. She glides out. A bench with a typewriter fills the far side of the yard.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Cole closes his eyes and hugs his mom tightly in an antique store filled with furniture. Anna peers into a cabinet at an antique engagement ring with a young couple. The couple appears intrigued, exchanging glances with each other and Anna. Sean enters, placing an antique bench down and sitting. Anna notices a birthday present on Sean's desk. Malcolm sits in his basement, staring into shadows, focusing on an audio tape playing static noise. Cole holds up a plastic rifleman, and Malcolm grasps its significance. In an empty church, Malcolm stands with Cole, who seems nervous. Malcolm's thoughts race as he sees Sean leaving his house and driving off, nearly causing an accident. Overcome with anger and pain, Malcolm watches Sean drive away. Cole rushes out of a tent and stumbles, a sewing machine visible on a table nearby.
